pull.title: ci: Use clang-15 and IWYU v0.19 in "tidy" task
pull.body:
There was a hope that the new IWYU [v0.19](https://github.com/include-what-you-use/include-what-you-use/releases/tag/0.19) gets rid of the entire `contrib/devtools/iwyu/bitcoin.core.imp`. Alas...

Based on https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26763.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#26859](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26859) (fuzz: extend ConsumeNetAddr() to return I2P and CJDNS addresses by vasild)
* [#26850](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26850) (ci: Stop and remove CI container by MarcoFalke)
* [#26763](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26763) (ci: Treat IWYU violations as errors by hebasto)
* [#26705](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26705) (clang-tidy: Check headers and fixes them by hebasto)
* [#25152](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25152) (refactor: Split util/system into exception, shell, and fs-specific files by Empact)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
I don't think we want to hop to non-LTS releases in the CI unless it's really required: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26296#issuecomment-1276344403.

> I don't think we want to hop to non-LTS releases in the CI unless it's really required: [#26296 (comment)](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26296#issuecomment-1276344403).

Agree. That's why this PR is a draft for now.

issue.title: clang-tidy: Fix `modernize-use-default-member-init` in headers and force to check all headers
issue.body:
This PR:
- fixes the only [remained](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26705#issuecomment-1353742082) check in headers, i.e., `modernize-use-default-member-init`
- forces `clang-tidy` check all headers

Closes bitcoin/bitcoin#26703.

issue.title: ci: Move `--enable-c++20` from "tidy" task back to "ASan..." one
issue.body:
This PR reverts cc7335edc87c6ef34429b4df94f53973db520aac from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25528 partially.

C++20 has introduced some new headers, and it is premature to consider them when using the IWYU tool.

Required for https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26763 and https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26766.

Related discussions:
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25528#discussion_r1058906785
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26763#discussion_r1058860943

issue.title: ci: Treat IWYU violations as errors
issue.body:
Fixes the https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24831#discussion_r861835262:
> Not sure if this is setting the return code to non-zero if it fails?

issue.title: fuzz: extend ConsumeNetAddr() to return I2P and CJDNS addresses
issue.body: In the process of doing so, refactor `ConsumeNetAddr()` to generate the addresses from IPv4, IPv6, Tor, I2P and CJDNS networks in the same way - by preparing some random stream and deserializing from it. Similar code was already found in `RandAddr()`.

issue.title: refactor: Split util/system into exception, shell, and fs-specific files
issue.body:
This is an attempt to significantly improve code organization while making changes as simple as possible to review.

Here I split four files out of `util/system`:
* `util/exception`, holding `PrintExceptionContinue`
* `util/shell`, holding `ShellEscape`, `runCommand`
* `util/fs`, holding various file, folder, and path-specific functions (building on `fs.h` and `filesystem`)
* `util/args`, holding `ArgsManager` and related functions

The goal was to minimize review burden, so I made an effort to minimize the diffs and only modify the code when it was easy to confirm that the change would not have negative consequences.

That said, sourcing all of the windows-related headers was not straightforward, so I expect I'll need to touch this up to correct any issues there.

issue.title: ci: Stop and remove CI container
issue.body:
This should not affect CI runs that have `DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST=1` set, for example `.cirrus.yml`.


However, when running CI locally with podman or docker, the container is stopped and thus deleted when all tests have passed. This feature was requested in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26843#issuecomment-1374445512 and can help to reduce used disk space when running several CI tasks subsequently.

events.body:
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
 This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

issue.title: ci: Use clang-15 in "tidy" task
issue.body:
Newer tools usually are better in terms of features and bug fixes.

Requested in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26642#issuecomment-1440230390.

Split from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26766.

events.body: Removing up for grabs here, as we are now using clang-16 and IWYU 0.20.

issue.title: ci, iwyu: Update mappings
issue.body:
This PR reduces false warnings, especially for unit tests.

From the Boost.Test's [point of view](https://github.com/boostorg/test/blob/d2895ebfdfdf16074c58c9801d53e190c4654fcb/include/boost/test/unit_test.hpp#L11), the `boost/test/unit_test.hpp` header:
```
... should be the only header necessary to include to start using the framework
```
